ALPHA: The name of the first letter of the Greek _____bet (Α,  α), followed by beta. In the Latin _____bet it is the predecessor to A.
BOOMER: A person born in the postwar years (generally considered in the United States and other Allied countries as between 1946 and the early 1960s), when there was a marked increase in birthrates throughout the Western world following the return of servicemen at the end of World War II.
GREATEST: Relatively large in scale, size, extent, number (i.e. having many parts or members) or duration (i.e. relatively long); very big.
MILLENNIAL: A demographic term for a person from the generation born from around the early 1980s to the mid 1990s or early 2000s; individuals who reached adulthood early in the 3rd millennium, C.E.
ZOOMER: A 6-letter word related to channel surfing.
